paragraphs.content: British Columbia Secondary School Diploma or equivalent with prior education in English at grade 10 level or higher.
Mature students who pass an entrance evaluation demonstrating sufficient ability (i.e., English comprehension and math skills) to undertake the program.
All applicants must demonstrate Englishproficiency through one of the above requirements or through an English language assessment (IELTS 5.5 or equivalent).

The objective of this program is to provide the student with opportunities to acquire and apply the knowledge of bookkeeping, office skills, and accounting to meet the demands of today's business. * Not all programs are offeredat
each location.

Computerized accounting is a growing area. Excellent opportunities exist for skilled people. Graduates can become employed in the accounting department of a large company as an assistant or be in charge of the accounts ina
smaller enterprise.

paragraphs.li_title:
Operating Systems
Basic level of proficiency in a Windows operating system

Word Processing
Basic level of proficiency in Microsoft Word

Spreadsheets
Intermediate level of proficiency in Microsoft Excel

Simulations and Drills
Practical Applications– 2 Units

Accounting
Sage 50 Premium Accounting, QuickBooks, Sage 300 General Ledger, Sage 300 Accounts Receivable, and Sage 300 Accounts Payable

Office Skills
Basic BookkeepingLevels 1 and 2, Internet Fundamentals, Office Procedures Level 1, and basic level of proficiency in Microsoft Outlook

Database Management
Basic level of proficiency in Microsoft Access

Business Skills
Business Math, Customer Service, Grammar Essentials for Business Writing, and Workplace Success/Intrapreneurship

Employability Skills
Job Search and Résumé Writing and Thought Patterns fora Successful Career
